class_notes: Synchronous class attendance required. Asynchronous assessments. Technology required: webcam and microphone.
course_description: This course is designed to introduce students to the style of analytical thinking required for research in the sciences and the concepts and procedures used in the conduct of empirical research. Students will be introduced to the basic toolkit of researchers which includes sampling, hypothesis testing, Bayesian inference, regression, experiments, instrumental variables, differences in differences, and regression discontinuity. More importantly, students will learn the principles of critical thinking essential for careful and credible research.
